isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - RADIO

svcsubproc.title: Radio, Cab 2 Speakers With AM-FM Cassette Radio and C.B. Radio 2-Way
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch (24) is in the ignition or accessories position, voltage is available through circuit 12, circuit 12A, fuse F16, circuit 86, and connector (39-D) to the AM/FM cassette radio. Power is also supplied from (J1) junction block, circuits 14R, 14D, fuse F22, circuit 86E, and connector (39-A) to the AM/FM cassette radio to retain station programming. The ground path is through connector (94), circuit 86-G, circuit 62-G (omitted with International electronic engines), circuit 11-GA and circuit 11-GF to cab ground.

The left rear speaker is fed through connector (94), a violet wire, connector (16), a light blue wire, connector (58), a white wire, and connector (56). The return path is through connector (56), a black wire, connector (58), a blue wire, connector (16), a light green wire, and connector (94) to the radio.

The right rear speaker is fed through connector (94), a violet wire, connector (16), a black wire, connector (58), a black wire, and connector (57). The return path is through connector (57), a white wire, connector (58), a light blue wire, connector (16), a light green wire, and connector (94) to the radio.

svcsubproc.title: Roof Mounted C.B. Radio Feed
svcsubproc.para: Voltage is present at (J1) junction block, circuit 14R, circuit 14D, fuse F21, circuit 86F, connector (237), the red wire, and circuit 86F to provide power for a roof mounted C.B. radio. The ground path provided is through circuit 86-GB, the black wire, connector (237), and circuit 86-GB to cab ground.

svcsubproc.title: Instrument Panel C.B. Radio Feed
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch (24) is in the ignition or accessories position, voltage is available through circuit 12, circuit 12A, fuse F16, circuit 86, circuit 86F, connector (236) and circuit 86F to the instrument panel mounted C.B. radio feed receptacle. The ground path is circuit 86-GB to the relay bracket left weld stud.

svcsubproc.title: Radio, Cab 4 Speakers With AM-FM Cassette Premium Radio
svcsubproc.para: When the key switch (24) is in the ignition or accessories position, voltage is available through circuit 12, circuit 12A, fuse F16, circuit 86, and connector (39-D) to the AM/FM cassette radio. Power is also supplied from (J1) junction block, circuits 14R, 14D, fuse F22, circuit 86E, and connector (39-A) to the AM/FM cassette radio to retain station programming. The ground path is through connector (94), circuit 86-G, circuit 62-G (omitted with International electronic engines), circuit 11-GA and circuit 11-GF to cab ground.

The left rear speaker is fed through connector (94), a violet wire, connector (16), a light blue wire, connector (58), a white wire, and connector (56). The return path is through connector (56), a black wire, connector (58), a black wire, connector (16), a light green wire, and connector (94) to the radio.

The right rear speaker is fed through connector (94), a violet wire, connector (16), a black wire, connector (58), a black wire, and connector (57). The return path is through connector (57), a white wire, connector (58), a light blue wire, connector (16), a light green wire, and connector (94) to the radio.

The left front speaker is fed through connector (39), the light green wire, connector (159), a white wire, and connector (259). The return path is through connector (259), a black wire, connector (159), the yellow wire, and connector (39) to the radio.

The right front speaker is fed through connector (39), the red wire, connector (159), a black wire, and connector (260). The return path is through connector (260), a white wire, connector (159), the brown wire, and connector (39) to the radio.
